item.title: Top needs pruning - nearly touching phone line, 6th October
item.description:
17 Bourne Road, BR2 9PB Hi, Thank you for my new street tree. I have been looking after it and it is doing well. However, it would benefit from some pruning as it is very straggly at the top and nearly touching the phone wires. As it is the time of year to carry out this activity I would greatly appreciate someone coming round with some lopers to trim the tops. Many thanks, Peter 17 Bourne Road, BR2 9PB

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous trees require canopies lifting to 5m from ground level and dead branches removing, 6th October
item.description:
The Elms Residents Company Ltd recently undertook a survey of trees on the Elms Estate. This included trees on the central traffic island on Hever Gardens. The island is owned by LBB and as a result the trees on the island are also owned by the Council. The report describes the trees as a "medium priority", defined as works required in the next 12 to 36 months before they are likely to represent a danger to public safety. Although we would note that the recent Storm Amy winds caused a number of very large dead branches to fall to the ground. We are happy to share the report with you but would encourage you to undertake your own assessment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hever Gardens, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Person dumping a bin bag right outside the entrance of our facility, 6th October
item.description:
Earlier today, a person left a bag full of waste directly outside our facility. This is completely unacceptable and adds to frustration we’ve been experiencing with the council’s lack of effective action regarding the surrounding environment.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Grange Yard, Old Kent Road, London
